travels.name: Bali
travels.description: Bali is an island and province of Indonesia known for its forested volcanic mountains, iconic rice paddies, beaches, and coral reefs. It's a popular destination for its vibrant culture, Hindu temples, and bustling nightlife.

travels.name: Yogyakarta
travels.description: Yogyakarta, often called Jogja, is a city on the island of Java known for its traditional arts and cultural heritage. It's home to two famous UNESCO World Heritage Sites, the Borobudur Temple and Prambanan Temple.

travels.name: Komodo National Park
travels.description: Komodo National Park is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and home to the Komodo dragon, the world's largest lizard. The park consists of several islands, offering stunning landscapes, crystal-clear waters, and diverse marine life, making it a perfect destination for diving and snorkeling.

travels.name: Raja Ampat
travels.description: Raja Ampat is an archipelago comprising over 1,500 small islands known for its pristine beaches, coral reefs, and abundant marine life. It's a paradise for divers and nature enthusiasts.

travels.name: Lombok
travels.description: Lombok is an island in West Nusa Tenggara province, offering beautiful beaches, waterfalls, and the iconic Mount Rinjani, a popular trekking destination.
highlights: Gili Islands (Gili Trawangan, Gili Air, Gili Meno)

travels.name: Jakarta
travels.description: Jakarta is the capital and largest city of Indonesia, known for its modern skyscrapers, cultural landmarks, and vibrant street life.

travels.name: Ubud
travels.description: Ubud is a town on the Indonesian island of Bali, known for its traditional crafts and dance. The surrounding Ubud District’s rainforest and terraced rice paddies, dotted with Hindu temples and shrines, are among Bali's most famous landscapes.

travels.name: Borobudur Temple
travels.description: Borobudur is a 9th-century Mahayana Buddhist temple in Magelang Regency, not far from the town of Muntilan, in Central Java, Indonesia. It is the world's largest Buddhist temple.

travels.name: Mount Bromo
travels.description: Mount Bromo, is an active volcano and part of the Tengger massif, in East Java, Indonesia. At 2,329 meters, it is not the highest peak of the massif but is the most well known.

travels.name: Gili Islands
travels.description: The Gili Islands are an archipelago of three small islands — Gili Trawangan, Gili Air, and Gili Meno — just off the northwest coast of Lombok, Indonesia.

travels.name: Tana Toraja
travels.description: Tana Toraja is a regency in the highlands of South Sulawesi, Indonesia. It's known for its unique culture, traditional houses, and elaborate funeral ceremonies.

travels.name: Mount Rinjani
travels.description: Mount Rinjani is an active volcano in Indonesia on the island of Lombok. It rises to 3,726 meters, making it the second-highest volcano in Indonesia.

travels.name: Bunaken
travels.description: Bunaken is an island near Manado in Northern Sulawesi, Indonesia. It is part of the Bunaken Marine Park, known for its vibrant coral reefs and diverse marine life.

travels.name: Bandung
travels.description: Bandung is the capital of West Java province in Indonesia and a vibrant city known for its art deco buildings, rich culture, and culinary delights.

travels.name: Derawan Islands
travels.description: The Derawan Islands are located in the Sulawesi Sea, on the coastal shelf of East Kalimantan, Indonesia. The islands are known for their pristine beaches and excellent diving spots.

travels.name: Mount Ijen
travels.description: Mount Ijen is an active stratovolcano in East Java, Indonesia. It's known for its iconic blue fire, the largest acidic crater lake in the world, and sulfur mining activities.

travels.name: Manado
travels.description: Manado is the capital of North Sulawesi province in Indonesia and a gateway to various natural attractions, including the Bunaken Marine Park.

travels.name: Nusa Penida
travels.description: Nusa Penida is a small island located southeast of Bali, known for its rugged landscapes, stunning cliffs, and beautiful beaches.

travels.name: Banda Islands
travels.description: The Banda Islands are a group of ten volcanic islands in the Banda Sea, about 2,000 km east of Java, Indonesia. The islands are known for their history as the legendary Spice Islands.

travels.name: Sumba
travels.description: Sumba is an island in eastern Indonesia, known for its unique traditional villages, impressive megalithic tombs, and beautiful landscapes.
